{{Quote|In the days of the Dark Kings, when a man could still walk dry-shod from the Rising of the Sun to the Sea of its setting, there lived in the fenced town of his people in the green hills of Agar an old man, by name [[Hazad|Hazad Longbeard]].|''[[The Peoples of Middle-earth]]'', [[Tal-Elmar (chapter)|Tal-Elmar]]}}

'''Agar''' was the name for the town in the story of [[Tal-Elmar]] while the land in the immediate vicinity was known as the [[Pinnath Gelin|Hills of Agar]].

== Description ==
There is a small green hilltop overlooking the town. The town itself is situated on the side of the hill while around it are many fields. There is also a place called the [[Moot-hill]], where the town-master gives meetings and announcements.

=== Geography ===
On its location little information is given, except that it was a region of green hills, situated "three leagues away" from the shores of the [[Belegaer|Great Sea]], and apparently closer to the ocean than the rival town of [[Udul]]. In a note near the end of the story there was a suggestion that the place was on the estuary of the [[Isen]] or perhaps the [[Morthond]]. There is also a hill between Agar and the sea known as the [[Golden Hill]].

== Politics ==
The town was ruled by a town-master, who is known as the [[Master of Agar]]. The town-master during the time when Tal-Elmar lived in the town was named [[Mogru]].<ref>{{PM|Elmar}}</ref>
